items.shortText: Adair to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: full on the pads, tucked to fine leg
healthy nick and gone! Was looking to guide this down to third man, instead picks out the keeper who takes an excellent catch. Second ODI wicket for Adair.

dismissal.text: Mosaddek Hossain c †Wilson b Adair 14 (17b 1x4 0x6) SR: 82.35

items.text: touch ahead of good length outside off, left alone
items.shortText: Adair to Sabbir Rahman, no run
Adair to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: sees the flight, drives hard to sweeper cover

items.shortText: Dockrell to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: new ball, please. He's deposited this over the sightscreen. Lovely sashay down the pitch to meet this on the half-volley as he muscled this away.

items.shortText: Adair to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: steered to square third man for an easy single

that's the end of that, steps out and hoicks this across the line to the wide long-on boundary. That's the end of that. Ireland are winless at the end of the tri-series, Bangladesh have made light work of this target.
items.postText: 6.10pm A berth in the final was already set up, but Bangladesh have been switched on all day. Yes, they saw Ireland put up stiff resistance courtesy Paul Stirling's century, but once they got past him, they tied the hosts into knots quite expertly. Abu Jayed's five-for should settle any doubts - if ever, they exist - while Liton's form after he replaced the rested Soumya Sakar should enthuse the team management. Tamim was his usual self, but they will be concerned with Shakib's side strain that forced him to retire hurt. Perhaps it's not serious and just a precautionary move, but surely the entire country will be a tad worried until they get an update from the physio. Thanks for joining us on the coverage. Hope to see you for the grand finale. Until then, this is Shashank Kishore saying goodbye on behalf of Sreshth Shah and Venkat Raghav. Cheers
items.shortText: Adair to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs
